Catawiki Automation
A Seleniumâ€‘based test automation framework for Catawiki features.
Built with Java, Maven, and Cucumber (BDD) to drive web browser
scenarios against the Catawiki site.
Created and Revised by - Souranu Maji

ðŸš€ Features
* Pageâ€‘object pattern for maintainable UI interactions
* Cucumber step definitions written in Gherkin (.feature files)
* Utilities for waits, verifications and screenshots
* Log4j2 configuration for test logging
* Test reports generated by Maven Surefire and Cucumber

ðŸ—‚ Project Structure

```
pom.xml
src/
 â”œâ”€ main/
 â”‚  â”œâ”€ java/             (production code â€“ currently unused)
 â”‚  â””â”€ resources/
 â””â”€ test/
    â”œâ”€ java/
    â”‚  â”œâ”€ Enums/
    â”‚  â”œâ”€ Pages/              (page object classes)
    â”‚  â”œâ”€ PageUtilities/      (helpers: waits, screenshots, verifications)
    â”‚  â””â”€ StepDefinitions/    (Cucumber step definitions & runner)
    â””â”€ resources/
       â”œâ”€ Drivers/            (browser driver binaries if needed)
       â””â”€ Features/           (.feature files defining scenarios)
target/                       (build output: classes, reports, screenshots)
```

ðŸ“¦ Prerequisites
* Tests are executed on Apple Macbook M5 Silicon (ARM)
* Java JDK 11+ (ensure java and javac are on your PATH)
* Maven 3.6+ (mvn command)
* Chrome browser (driven via WebDriver)
* (Optional) appropriate WebDriver binaries in Drivers

  
ðŸ›  Setup
* Clone the repository
  ```
  git clone <repo-url>
  cd com.catawiki.automation
  ```
* Install dependencies
  ```
  mvn clean install
  ```
* Configure drivers
* Place chromedriver, geckodriver, etc. in Drivers folder or adjust your PATH.
Adjust configuration

Edit log4j2.xml for logging preferences.
Modify any base URLs or timeouts in page objects or utilities.

ðŸ§ª Running Tests

* Execute all Cucumber tests via Maven:
  ```
  mvn test
  ```

* Run a specific feature or runner class:
  ```
  mvn test -Dtest=TestRunner
  ```
* During submission only @Positive_Test is added under CucumberOptions's tags [TestRunner.java]. Different tags can
  be used like - @Smoke_Test, @Negative_Test inside CucumberOptions tags.

After execution, results are available in cucumber-report.html and
surefire-reports.

ðŸ”§ Utilities & Helpers

* waitUtils â€“ explicit/wait helpers
* verificationUtils â€“ assertion helpers/logging
* takesScreenshotUtils â€“ capture screenshots on failure

ðŸ“‚ Reporting & Artifacts
* Screenshots saved to screenshots
* Cucumber JSON/HTML reports in target
* Maven Surefire XML reports in surefire-reports
  
ðŸŒ AI - Assistance
* Generate README.md file to maintain sections
* Editing Comments to maintain consistency across the files

** TEST EXECUTION RESULT -> entire TestSuite (/Users/souranumaji/Documents/com.catawiki.automation/target/testEvidence/FullSuiteExexutionCucumberReport.html)
** TEST EXECUTION RESULT -> HappyPath/Positive Test
